activities:
Infogroup Inc. (Infogroup) may receive the following personal information from the EU:
1.  Human Resources information
2.  Customer/prospect contact information
3.  Executive information contained within the data supplied to Infogroup by its information providers.  
Infogroup may use the first two sources of personal information for its internal administration and sales activities, respectively.   Infogroup may include the executive information in its various business information product offerings.

Infogroup Inc.'s subsidiaries in the United States include (but are not limited to):  Direct Media Holdings, Inc.; Direct Media, LLC; GoTime Corporation; infoUSA Inc.; infoUSA Marketing, Inc.; Walter Karl, Inc.; Yesmail, Inc.; and Yesmail International Holdings, Inc.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: On-Line, Off-Line, Manually Processed Data, Human Resource Data
recoursemech: Infogroup Inc. will comply with the EU Data Protection Authorities and the Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner.
